text:
Hi , i have a big problem with a listing page created with hubdb.
My client when changing hubdb records the listing remains cached for days and days.
I tried printing the local_dt variable in an html comment but it does not change the situation.
<@U25PYL3Q8> <@U7SL518D6>
How many records is the table? How often does it change?

Records are few , we are talking at most 100.
They change very often though , for example I have a client who had a cached version from 10 days ago, it's really urgent as a thing.
<@U25PYL3Q8>

When I’m having problems with this, I’ll create a hubl macro that creates a 20ish character random string —

On page load, check to see if a variable exists in the query params, if not, then populate it, then redirect he page…

so if <http://website.com/hubdb|website.com/hubdb> is loaded, it redirects to <http://website.com/hubdb?key=aIoqTG7VNXhZnJwCbjKe|website.com/hubdb?key=aIoqTG7VNXhZnJwCbjKe>
if key exists, do nothing — that way we don’t end up in a redirect loop
I don’t know what an official answer is
Uhm sure so I could solve it but I don't like it as a solution ... I don't understand why HubSpot has this problem ( I read that I am not the only one )

There are lots of things I don’t like in life.. I once tried to fly in the air, but I couldn’t. No matter how many times I yelled out, no matter how many times I complained to my mom — I was still unable to fly like superman.

As I got older I got into airplanes. It isn’t a solution I like, but it is the only solution I could find to get me to places far away, quickly.
lol
If I had a better one, I’d offer it — but there is no way that I’m aware of to “trigger” a change in the hubdb caching.

I do have an idea, haven’t tested it yet, but basically putting a table switcher in the module on page, and switching the table for a new one (maintaining two hubdb tables, and then after an update, change the table that the module is pointed to — I don’t have a lot of faith in it, but it was worth a try next time I have the issue
I notice i have the entire website cached 20 days ago , it's absurd
What do you earn you noticed. How are you getting this?
Simple refresh of page
And you can say that is your browser fault or HubSpot fault?
So many of my visitors are having the same problem , so I assume it is HubSpot's "fault"
Hard refreshing clears local cache, right?
So on mac, cmd shift r would hard refresh
Or you could manually clear cache and cookies
Does that resolve?
yes and it's works
Then new data shows up?
but the problem is i have on this website a loooong cache
exactly
So the browser is caching this and the server isn’t telling your browser they are wrong
yes

I’ve had a hate for the cache setting for HubSpot

I see the necessary evil here being caching large hubdb tables to prevent server load rising in popular pages, but I think this should be addressed.
Another question here, when updating the tables do you have new rows? Or just updated data?

If you’re seeing old HubDB data showing on a page after the HubDB has been updated contact HubSpot support. <http://Help.HubSpot.com|Help.HubSpot.com>

If you do that it enables our engineers to fix the problem for everyone.
Updated data, but I noticed that the problem is not only on the pages related hubdb
Even still, same thing, if you’re making changes and it doesn’t seem like they’re being reflected. Contact HubSpot support. Doing so gives us the ability to fix any issues.
Can I put a request to have somewheres to easily access the GraphiQL explorer for accounts? I keep forgetting the URL for it lmao.
<https://app.HubSpot.com/l/graphiql>
Once the developer nav is out to more people, hopefully it is more discoverable :laughing:
There are also links to it in .graphql files in the Design Manager
sweet ok

<@U6W3H6YN8> when can I start harrasing you for allowing GraphQL if a account has a enterprise level product no matter waht it is? :V Especially if they have Operations Hub to be able to use GraphQL in workflows
I would also like to harrass someone about this. :joy:
lol
As much as you like, because I am trying to make this happen too. The more use cases you run into and can share the better.
Does someone want to create a form for use cases?

have a perfect case right now:

had to make a workflow that associates a ticket to a custom object depending on a email enterred into a ticket that corresponds to a email on a CO. Right now I have to pull:

The association of a Ticket to a Contact (1 API Call)
Then take the ID from the above and query the Contact API to get the Contacts email (1 API Call)
Then query the Custom Objects API for a match of the cotacts email and return the ID (1 API Call)
THEN grab the ID of the Ticket that enterred the workflow and the ID from the above step and make a association (another API call)

With GraphQL I can turn that down to 2 API calls
It would be great if you could file an ideas forum ticket, and upvote and comment on that. That is a helpful way for us to track the request.
